column34: Components Aggregate to Totals (scroll down for contribution consistency checks)
Total bankruptcies = Creditors petitions + debtors applications

column1: Percentage change, latest quarter (2020 Q2) compared with:
1 Figures from 2011 Q2 onwards based on the date the bankruptcy order was granted by the court or the Adjudicator.

2 For any particular quarter, seasonally adjusted figures for creditor and debtor petition bankruptcies will not sum to the seasonally adjusted figure for total bankruptcies. This is because they have been adjusted separately using different models. Over a calendar year, the totals will match because of the model chosen.
3 From October 2015, the minimum debt required to initiate a creditor petition bankruptcy increased from £750 to £5,000.
4 From 6 April 2016, the process for people making themselves bankrupt moved online and out of the courts.
